intro: Graphistylis argyrotricha, commonly known as the silver-haired grass. It is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, silver-tomentose leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Graphistylis argyrotricha is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
